titleStmt.title: A copy of the Kings Maiesties letters pattents for the rating and assessing the prices of horsemeat for innes and hosteries thorowout the kingdome
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)

titleStmt.title: A copy of the Kings Maiesties letters pattents for the rating and assessing the prices of horsemeat for innes and hosteries thorowout the kingdome
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
Mompesson, Giles, Sir, 1584-1651?
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Beale, and are to be sold by Richard Hawkins in Chancery lane,

notesStmt.note: Authorizing the justices of assize to set rates in the counties, etc. as an aid to Sir Giles Mompesson (and two others) in enforcing his patent for rating the prices of horsemeat.
The letters patent signed and dated on p. 16: VVestminster the fourth day of Nouember, in the sixteenth yeere of our reigne of England, France and Ireland, and of Scotland the two and fiftieth.
Identified as STC 9240a on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
